chart.title: Literacy rate vs. GDP per capita
chart.subtitle: Share of people aged 15+ who can both read and write with understanding a short simple statement about their everyday life. GDP per capita is adjusted for inflation and differences in the cost of living between countries.
chart.note: GDP per capita is expressed in [international-$](#dod:int_dollar_abbreviation) at 2017 prices.
chart.citation: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (2024); Our World in Data; World Bank (2023)

GDP per capita, PPP (constant 2017 inter.descriptionShort: This data is adjusted for inflation and for differences in the cost of living between countries.
descriptionKey: This GDP per capita indicator provides information on economic growth and income levels from 1990.
This data is adjusted for inflation and for differences in the cost of living between countries.
This data is expressed in international-$ at 2017 prices.
For GDP per capita estimates in the very long run, see the [Maddison Project Database's indicator](https://ourworldindata.org/grapher/gdp-per-capita-maddison).

Population (historical).descriptionShort: Population by country, available from 10,000 BCE to 2023, based on data and estimates from different sources.
Population (historical).descriptionProcessing:
The population data is constructed by combining data from multiple sources:

- 10,000 BCE - 1799: Historical estimates by HYDE (v3.3).

- 1800 - 1949: Historical estimates by Gapminder (v7).

- 1950-2023: Population records by the UN World Population Prospects (2024 revision).
Population (historical).citationShort: HYDE (2023); Gapminder (2022); UN WPP (2024) – with major processing by Our World in Data
Population (historical).citationLong: HYDE (2023); Gapminder (2022); UN WPP (2024) – with major processing by Our World in Data. “Population (historical)” [dataset]. PBL Netherlands Environmental Assessment Agency, “History Database of the Global Environment 3.3”; Gapminder, “Population v7”; United Nations, “World Population Prospects”; Gapminder, “Systema Globalis” [original data].
